page.title: 09LOCAL CUSTOMS-ANSTEY
page.content:
{Anstey Gala and Procession.} This originated from the annual Barrow Race which was held as part of the local Wakes Week Celebration. In 1977 it was decided to hold a gala to celebrate the Queen's Silver Jubilee and revive the custom of choosing a Queen and attendants.
{May Celebrations.} In 1984 children from Anstey Latimer School made Leicestershire May Crosses to celebrate May Day. In 1985 this was turned into a May Celebration throughout the village,with the {Anstey Morris Men and Royal Chalfont {Garland Dancers}and local children, processing the{May Crosses and Jack o' {the Green.}It is hoped,that like the gala,this will become an annual event.
